DOC.brief_summary: The aim is to compare the results of using T-provisional and Mini-Crush stenting techniques in patients with bifurcation lesions in the CTO segment.
DOC.brief_title: T-provisional Stenting vs Mini-Crush in Chronic Total Occlusions (CTO)
DOC.criteria: Patients considered for coronary angioplasty with stenting due to Ischemic heart disease (Stable angina, Unstable angina, nonST Myocardial Infarction). Bifurcation side branch diameter >2 mm in CTO segment, verified by coronary angiography Successful CTO recanalization Signed, documented informed consent prior to admission to the study Age <18 years or >75 years Left main artery bifurcation lesion Reocclusion CTOs Renal insufficiency (GFR/MDRD <30 ml/min) Subject has a platelet count < 100,000 cells/mm3 or > 700,000 cells/mm3. Known nonadherence to double antiplatelet therapy (DAPT) LVEF <30% Continuing bleeding Acute coronary syndrome (STelevation Myocardial infarction) Anamnesis of previous CABG Pregnancy
